member.name: M:DHI.Services.TimeSeries.BasicAnalysis.GapFill(DHI.Services.TimeSeries.ITimeSeriesData{System.Double},DHI.Services.TimeSeries.TimeSeriesDataType)
member.summary: Replaces null values with interpolated values according to the time series data type. If the time series data type is not explicitly defined, the data type 'Instantaneous' is assumed.
member.param: Time series data to be gap-filled

member.name: M:DHI.Services.TimeSeries.BasicAnalysis.MovingAverage(DHI.Services.TimeSeries.ITimeSeriesData{System.Double},System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the moving average over a given window.

member.name: M:DHI.Services.TimeSeries.BasicAnalysis.PercentileValue(DHI.Services.TimeSeries.ITimeSeriesData{System.Double},System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the value below which the input percentage of all values in time series data fall.
member.returns: The value below which the percentage of input values fall.

member.name: M:DHI.Services.TimeSeries.BasicAnalysis.Resample(DHI.Services.TimeSeries.ITimeSeriesData{System.Double},System.TimeSpan,DHI.Services.TimeSeries.TimeSeriesDataType)
member.summary: Resamples a time series to a time series with time steps equivalent to the given time span. The time series values are found using interpolation according to the time series data type. if the time series data type is not explicitly defined, the data type 'Instantaneous' is assumed.
member.param: The time span between time steps.

member.name: M:DHI.Services.TimeSeries.BasicAnalysis.ToEquidistant``1(DHI.Services.TimeSeries.ITimeSeriesData{``0},System.TimeSpan,System.Nullable{``0},System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{System.DateTime})
member.summary: Returns new time series data with regular interval and values from the original data when available. Values are copied from the original time series data when the new time step coincides precisely with a time step in the original data. The fill value is used at points that have no coincident point in the original data. Points that are in the original data but do not coincide with any of the time steps in the new data are ignored. No interpolation is performed. If the original data is empty and no start time is specified, the result will have no entry. If the original data is empty and a start time is specified, the result will have a single entry.
member.param: Regular interval to be used in the new data
Value to use at time steps that do not coincide with any time step in the original data.
First time for the new data. If null (default), the first time available in the original data will be used.

Last time for the new data. If null (default), the last time available in the original data will be used. If the specified end time cannot be reached using a regular time step from the first time in the new data, the last time in the new data will be the last time that can be reached using a regular time step before the specified end time.

member.name: M:DHI.Services.TimeSeries.BasicAnalysis._CreateNewTimeSeriesDataWithRegularTimeStepAndConstantValue``1(System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.TimeSpan,System.Nullable{``0})
member.summary: Create new time series data with regular time step and filled with a constant value. If start and end time are not specified, the result will have no data points. If only start or only end time are specified, result will have a single data point with the specified time.
member.param: Start time and starting point for all intervals.
End time, no data will be added after this time.
Use this value for all time steps in the new time series data

member.name: T:DHI.Services.TimeSeries.DurationCurveAnalysis
member.summary: Time series data extension method for creation of a duration curve.

member.name: M:DHI.Services.TimeSeries.DurationCurveAnalysis.DurationCurve(DHI.Services.TimeSeries.ITimeSeriesData{System.Double},System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Duration curve.
member.param: The minimum number of values accepted. If time series data does not contain enough values (!= null) an exception is thrown.

member.name: T:DHI.Services.TimeSeries.ReduceAnalysis
member.summary: Time series data extension method for reduction.

member.name: M:DHI.Services.TimeSeries.ReduceAnalysis.Reduce(DHI.Services.TimeSeries.ITimeSeriesData{System.Double},System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reduces the specified time series data using the Ramer–Douglas–Peucker algorithm but maintains the general shape of the series.
member.param: The tolerance expressed as a percentage of the difference between maximum and minimum value of the input data.
The required minimum number of data points to trigger a reduction
member.exception: There should be at least three values in the time series.
The relative tolerance should be higher than 0 and lower than 100.

member.name: T:DHI.Services.TimeSeries.SmoothingAnalysis
member.summary: Time series data extension method for smoothing analysis.

member.name: M:DHI.Services.TimeSeries.SmoothingAnalysis.SavitskyGolay(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Double},System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Smooth the input data and reserve the peaks using the Savitsky-Golay filter.
member.param: An odd number of data points used to estimate the central data.
The order of the estimating polynomial.

member.name: M:DHI.Services.TimeSeries.SmoothingAnalysis.Smoothing(DHI.Services.TimeSeries.ITimeSeriesData{System.Double},System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Smooth the time series data and reserve the peaks using the Savitsky-Golay filter.
member.param: An odd number of data points used to estimate the central data.
The order of the estimating polynomial.

The type of the time series values.
